text: Ochreinauclea missionis is a species of plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is endemic to India. It is threatened by habitat loss. The caterpillars of the commander (Limenitis procris), a brush-footed butterfly, utilize this species as a food plant. ==Sources== * CAMP Workshops on Medicinal Plants, India 1998. Ochreinauclea missionis. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. title: Ochreinauclea missionis
